Why it is that most people believe bo2 to be one of the best call of duty 
games is beyond me. I think it is the worst one. Terrible campaign, they 
ruined the zombies storyline and don't get me started on multiplayer. The 
guns in that game in general are unbalanced and bulky, and the worst part 
was detail... the maps were to plain, very little (if any at all) hiding 
spots or jump spots that make the game seem bigger without actually being 
bigger and they made it so easy that my 4 year old niece could beat most 
people if she had any assault rifle... to sum it up... the guns are 
unbalanced, bulky, and overpowered, the maps have little detail and have to 
much blocked off, zombies is just plain ruined with robots and ghosts and 
whatnot, and the campaign is just crap being that I could equip pretty much 
any gun and not have to worry about being gunned down because I've got the 
best gun. But this is merely my opinion which I have a right to and no one 
can change that.﻿

If there is something I have notice with rating the best Call of Duty title 
is that mostly everyone who says Mw3, Ghosts, Black ops, or World at War 
sucks or claims is the worst one in the franchise, all they seem to play is 
multiplayer. I'm not saying everyone is like that, but it is the majority 
of the reviews. Plus some claim Mw2 is the best, don't get me wrong I 
personally loved the campaign and multiplayer, but to be fairly honest, Mw3 
is the upgraded and complete form of what Mw2 was supposed to be, and I say 
the reason why they consists why Mw2 was perfect is because that was 
probably their first experience in Call of Duty. Of course the newest 
titles will never compare to the first one you played, especially if all 
you do is play the multiplayer, get this, nothing will change at all, just 
new settings, guns, perks, or equipment, maybe if that's you're opinion on 
the franchise try something new, instead of just trash talking something of 
it's own.﻿

I haven't played the original 3 Call Of Duty games so I couldn't rank them 
on this list but I do know that Ghosts was not fun, AW had a great campaign 
and was fun for about a month, World At War was fun for the campaign and 
especially zombies, Black Ops multiplayer was great as well as the zombies 
and story, MW3 had a lot of great things like infected, BO2 was an all 
around great game, COD 4 and MW2 I feel can be interchangeable because they 
are both such great games. Black Ops 2 could be included because I think 
multiplayer wise, it's one of the better ones. At this point, I don't think 
anything will beat Modern Warfare, depending on what Treyarch comes out 
with this November.﻿

Coming from a person that was introduced to the series @ Cod 2 on the PS2. 
This is my list:

Now keep in mind that I never played MP on Cod 1-3.

11. Ghosts - Spawn system is so broken that it hurts the game that much, 
didn't have a campaign worth finishing.

10. Cod 3 - Imo a weaker version of Cod 2

9. Cod 1 - I admire the health system. But no Multiplayer....

8. Advanced Warfare - Cliche story already used in MW2, definite change in 
gameplay with Jetpacks. While the jetpacks aren't my thing really, this is 
an upgrade from Ghosts.

7.  Black Ops 1 - Easily the worst Multiplayer out of any CoD. It's only 
above Ghosts, 1, 3, & AW is because of its story, zombies, and Gambling

6. Cod 2 - Best Campaign in the CoD Franchise

5. Black Ops 2 - Multiplayer was an upgrade from Black Ops 1, although 
still weak compared to the MW games. The DLC Zombie maps were pretty good 
in this game (personally not a fan of Buried though), Tranzit blows. The 
story was iffy, the alternations were more interesting than the plot itself.

4. MW2 - This game was really great back in 2009. But looking back at this 
game, it's overrated. People are so quick to wank MW2, yet are so quick to 
forget: Care Package duping, Javelin-Semtex glitch, Shotguns as a 
secondary, Stopping Power being a must have for Perk 2, One Man Army + Noob 
Tubing being OP, and the fact that you had the nuke once you get a 7 
killstreak. I will say MW2 had a good weapon balance (excluding shotgun 
secondaries and Noob tubes), MW2 had the best Maps, and a decent 
story/campaign mode. MW2 does have the best Spec Ops mode.

3. MW3 - I'm going to be in the minority putting this game as high as I did 
but I have my reasons: MW3 was MW2 without the Bullshit mainly.

No Stopping power, no Shotgun secondaries, no One Man Army + Noob tube, 
much less glitches than MW2, faceoff mode, survival mode, infection 
gametype in multiplayer. I will say that Primary Weapon balance wasn't as 
good (looking at you MP7 and ACR), the Recon Perk was a pain w/o Dead 
silence, the maps were okay but the best weren't as good as MW2's best 
maps, and the overall campaign story not as good as MW2 (they were roughly 
the same). I keep pushing questions on why people hate MW3 as much as they 
do, and even in 2015 I still haven't gotten legitimate reasons why this 
game is so bad.

2. Cod 4 - A game that I feel doesn't get the love that it does because 
most started on MW2 and onwards. Cod 4 and World at War respectively have 
always been the best CoDs in terms of core gameplay. This has always been 
due to the fact that these games had the basics mastered since there was 
less crap being stuffed in to these games. Only complaints off the top of 
my head are: Gametypes excluding FFA being played on Shipment, and the 
knife being worthless.

1. World At War - A reskinned CoD 4 with the hardest campaign in the 
franchise, and Zombie mode. Not to mention the only cod with TANKS!﻿

My list: (haven't played AW so it is not present)
10: Ghosts- forgettable campaign, slowest and the least re-designed 
multiplayer bur Extinction was decent
9: COD 2- decent but I preferred the Big Red One than this
8: COD 1- revolutionary, decent story
7: COD 3- was good overall, still played today online on PC by many
6: MW3: disappointing overall, tried to be more than it actually is, and 
there definitely wasn't "Last Stand" in that game as promised 
5: WaW: Decent story but multiplayer was unbalanced and ruined by hackers; 
many argue that this game is the best for zombies however
4: BO1: one of the best story lines in the series, multiplayer could be 
considered a let down after MW2 but this game is my favorite for zombies
3: COD4: MW- great storyline, revolutionized the entire series, overall 
just a great game
2: MW2- another great storyline but the multiplayer could get pretty 
unbalanced (which also made it great) and the co-op missions were fantastic 
1: BO2- the best storyline connected with BO1, zombies was great with new 
modes introduced, the multiplayer was fast paced and action packed with 
some of the best scorestreaks, and the pick-10 system helped balance 
multiplayer as well

My list
WAW (First online COD, zombies and I just like WW2 games)
COD 4 (Does it have to be explained?)
BO1 (Vietnam is an interesting backdrop, and also the game was overall good 
and rewarded good play- but the lag was BAD!)
BO2 (Good game, however lag held it back and a few balancing issues as 
well- R870, AN-94, QuickScoping)
MW2 (Would be the best game by far, BUT, the one man army exploiting and 
the noob tubes and the overall lack of support from IW stops it from being 
higher on my list)
Ghosts (Not a popular game, you died WAY too fast, thermal was OP, Danger 
close and C4, too little innovation)
MW3 (Completely terrible, Dead Mans Hand, MP7/ACR completely destroyed 
almost everything, Dual FMJ9 and MP9, Support too good and specialist was 
stupid, also it was essentially a MW2 DLC)
AW (Weapon balancing is Atrocious, System Hack, Skill based matchmaking, 
terrible connections and also it isn't COD, so it's bottom of my list)

From the CoD games I've played
8. CoD 3: First time playing a WW2 CoD game, and it sucked
7. Advanced Warfare: The game launched great, but then Sledgehammer fucked 
it up
6. MW2: Overrated multiplayer, but fantastic campaign
5. WaW: Amazing Campaign, good multiplayer, and zombies
4. Ghosts: Very underrated, best hit detection and great gun balance
3. CoD4: Most balanced CoD, still amazing to this date
2. MW3: First time playing a CoD and FPS in general, aside from Republic 
Commando. Survival mode was a blast, Multiplayer improved on MW2, and had a 
great campaign that wrapped up MW perfectly
1. BO2: Best Multiplayer, Campaign, and Survival in the series, plus 
offline bots for when you don't have internet﻿

As an actual fan of the series since COD1 on PC, and as someone who plays 
every genre of game out there too(just saying that I enjoy diversity in 
games, but respect FPS games for what they actually are)...here is my list:
This does not include spin offs or handheld titles. 

11.Call Of Duty 3
10. Call Of Duty: MW3
9: Call Of Duty: Ghosts
8: Call Of Duty
7. Call Of Duty: Black Ops 2
6. Call Of Duty: MW2
5. Call Of Duty 2
4. Call Of Duty: Advanced Warfare
3. Call Of Duty World At War
2. Call Of Duty 4: Modern Warfare
1. Call Of Duty: Black Ops


You just can't beat Treyarchs crazy stories, though the ORIGINAL team of 
Infinity Ward truly defined the term "Blockbuster" in a FPS.
Which is why they each share the top spots.
COD4 reinvented the genre while Black Ops created a story that could match 
adventure games in some ways, and learned that you can have a serious plot 
with crazy twists and turns, all while keeping a light heart towards the 
subject matter.
Treyarch didn't depend on "controversial imagery" to sell their game, after 
IW gave the series a major spotlight after "Speak No Russian".
And with Sledgehammer latest entry, they prove that they can provide a 
fresh take on the series, but still can't top the story telling and mystery 
of Treyarchs games.
Here is to 2015 as it'll be Treyarchs turn next and I can't wait!

Mine would be call of duty modern warfare 2﻿

1) Modern Warfare 2 (BEST multiplayer experience I ever had. The  new 
killstreaks (nuke, AC130, etc), best maps of any CoD, cool weapons, and a 
great campaign. Spec Ops was really fun to play with friends on Co-Op)

2) Black Ops II (Campaign: Menendez was a great villain, the story was 
dark, dramatic and felt like a movie. Couple that with the ability to make 
choices and affect the ending so that it was non-linear made it the best 
campaign of all the CoDs. Multiplayer was GREAT and refreshing (aside from 
the terrible hit detection and lag), and the new zombies maps were 
innovative)

3) COD4: Modern Warfare (Reset the standard for FPS's, what else can I say?)

4) Modern Warfare 3 (Modern Warfare 2.5. Still, I loved modern warfare 2 
multiplayer, and MW3 was a nice polish to its predecessor. Great campaign 
also)

5) Black Ops (Who else but Treyarch to make a deep and interesting 
campaign? Multiplayer was really fun but a little too slow. Took Zombies to 
a whole new level)

6) World At War (Decent campaign, amazing multiplayer. Zombies for the 
first time was a great experience)

7) Advanced Warfare (EXO's ruined multiplayer, way too easy to get a kill. 
Too fast paced, and really didn't feel like CoD (felt more like titanfall). 
However the multiplayer was refreshing and was a huge step-up from Ghosts. 
Campaign was pretty good. Exo Zombies meh..)

8) COD 2 (No complaints)

9) COD 3 (Never played, still better than ghosts)

10) COD (Never played, still better than ghosts)

...

11) Ghosts (nice fish AI)﻿

I personally think that AW is one of my favorites. I know the game isn't

different, it has a different feel. Plus, how can you not call it fun to 
fly around with jet packs and shoot lasers. Unlike lots of people, I 
actually like exo zombies, yes, it's very different, but it's still fun.

different, different zombies, different dangers. Now I will put an 
exception on Infection/ Burger town. That map wasn't too good. Outbreak was

agree, and you don't have to disagree.﻿

I think the last good Call of Duty game was Black Ops from 2010, after that 
they took a path down a sad dark road of giving us half baked campaigns 
that any unpaid intern can come up with, making multiplayer maps that any 
noob can dominate in just by using cheap tactics to win. Let me list a few 
of those tactics, camping in a corner, using the second chance perk to 
escape death and kill your enemy when you should've died, saving kill 
streaks only to spam them later and get more kill streaks, and last but not 
least the spawn trapper, they will kill you instantly right when you spawn 
in. I wonder when Activision is gonna realize that in order to keep the 
game sales up they need to give the developer more time and make something 
interesting and story driven with a better multiplayer than before. Don't 
force it out the door just to make a few quick bucks, sadly that day isn't 
gonna come until we stop buying the games, then they'll do what we want, 
and Call Of Duty will be good again.﻿

Refined a good formula my ass, the formula got fucked up way too many times 
over and over again, here is some education from a true old school call of 
duty fan:
1. CoD4 - did most things right, fun, well balanced, innovative, made 
sense, campaign was cool, weapons were great, community excellent, what it 
didn't was in it's own way also likeable
2. Call of Duty 2 - as good as ww2 games get, a worthy sequel to a great 
first game, multiplayer underrated on it
3. Call of duty - the original, the daddy, say what you will it still holds 
up, it saw what the others ww2 games couldn't and did it themselves
4. World at war - treyarch came back for an another fillar game until next 
IW but fine enough it was, tanks were cool
5. Black ops - after IW expectedly went the route of stagnation and selling 
out treyarch surprised with a not as bad game
6. MW2 - beggining of the end of IW and CoD, good enough but it marked the 
end
7,8,9,10... - all hope lost, CoD is what it is now, MW3, black ops 2, 
ghosts, aw... awful, time to move on﻿

I agree that the exo-suits and futuristic abilities made the game feel 
refreshingly different, but I absolutely despise the impact they have on 
actual combat in the game. It genuinely made me miss the jetpack-less 
combat of previous Call of Duty games. I love how fast you can get from A 
to B using the exo suit, but it has been detrimental to the pure FPS 
experience, in my opinion. If they keep adding these futuristic gadgets 
that affect actual combat, I'll no longer consider them part of what I used 
to define as Call of Duty games - I'll refer to them as sci-fi, FPS games.

save this game)

innovative)

4. CoD (Nothing beats the classics, innovative, creative, and original)

amazing, and the game is just fun)
2. Ghosts (With an emotional story, Extinction, and great A.I., this highly 
criticized game was surprisingly fun)
1. Modern Warfare 3 (Survival, Chaos mode, WW3, and a campaign with so much 
action: Michael Bay would be jealous)﻿

I rank the CoDs: *(my opinion, my list.)*

10. Ghosts. Overall, an absolutely shit CoD. Multiplayer was shit, Campaign 
was shit and Extinction was bad but not shit. Killed the series off, but it 
survived, miraculously.

9. MW3.
It was ok, I liked killing Makarov at the end, and Spec Ops was fun, but 
the multplayer was a let-down.

8. CoD 3. It was fun and the campaign was really good. Didn't play it much, 
but there's my opinion. (First CoD I played.)

7. BO2. A let down of the series. Although the multiplayer was alright.

6. W@W. Zombies. Epic Campaign. Fun Multiplayer = A good game.

5. Advanced warfare. I am gonna get hate for this, I just love the Exo 
movement, most online maps are cool, the end of the campaign was super fun, 
and weapon variants are a great addition to the game.

4. Black Ops, had a great story line, and one word. Zombies. *oh and 
nuketown*

3. CoD 2. this is a filler, I haven't played it, but I imagine it's good.

2. Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare.
This game had my favourite campaign and mission (all ghillied up) and the 
multiplayer was second best. After, of course...

1. Modern Warfare 2.
The best multiplayer in the series, 3rd best Campaign (after BO and CoD4) 
and Spec Ops, a great addition to the franchise at the time.

So yeah, I hope you agree with the list, don't be too angry if you aren't.﻿

10 - Never Played it.
9 - World At War was bad! A stepback! Played it too safe! One word, Zombies.
8 - Was pretty much the same as MW2 in terms of graphics and play style, 
just without the many flaws and glitches in MW2.
7 - Never played but in no way should beat WaW or MW3.
6 - You said nothing bad about it, so why is it all the way back at 6? 
smh... Then you add the insane improvements they added to zombies and you 
get one of the biggest communities created on YouTube, the zombies 
community, which in my opinion had the biggest impact on popularising 
COD.Yes a lot of people played MW2, yes MW made the mutiplayer popular, but 
add multiplayer with the equally as big, if not bigger, zombie community, 
you have double the fanbase and more people playing your game.
5 - It's not even that good, it's literally just held fondly by nostalgia, 
it's no different than MW3 but with everything thats annoying with COD, 
Noobtubers, Snipers, That stupid resupply perk, so 5 is a fitting spot.
4 - Ghosts ins't even that bad, I'm not saying it's exactly good, but it's 
nowhere near as bad as people label it, but I can't say the same for 
extinction, what an atrocity. Hopefully they improve things in Ghosts 2, 
which I would rather have than MW4.
3 - Why the hell is this old turd even in the top 3? Just because it's old 
and was good for the standard back in the day, doesn't mean it's good now.
2 - How did I know this masterpiece would be second to MW, this game is 
better in every way, kick-ass streaks, the scorestreak system as a whole, 
the weapons, the gamemodes, the maps, you name it, BO2 does it better. And 
then we have zombies, yes Transh!t was bad, and yes Die Rise was a bit of a 
let down, but MOTD and Origins are 2 of the best, arguably the best to 
some, maps that Treyarch have ever made. How can you measure all of that to 
a game that doesn't even let you customise what streaks you get?
1 - Another example of whatever was good back in the day is better than 
whatever the kids of these days play. No, just no. Get rid of all the 
nostalgia and you have your average shooter game. It's no different to half 
of the other COD's on this list. You are the WatchMojo of video games, you 
know how to anger your fans. Just like WatchMojo, if it was good then, you 
disregard everything else and just put this at number 1. It's basically a 
top 9, you put no actual thought into this list. All it is, is multiplayer 
that is simple and a campaign that I haven't even played because most 
people, not all, don't even care about the COD campaign, and saying that, I 
actually played the BO2 campaign, that's how good that game is. Face it 
those who are all butt-hurt right now, this is only number 1 because of 
nostalgia, remove that factor and you have yourself a new number 1.

And before you call me a Treyarch fanboy, you are absolutely correct, every 
one of their games are great because they actually tried something new with 
zombies and when you have multiplayer as good as BO2 with zombie maps as 
good as MOTD, you simply can't argue that BO2 is better than MW and that 
Treyarch is better than Infinity Ward.﻿

still was too unpredictable to play the maps with tactics)
4. CoD: WaW (it is an awesome title having highly addictive multiplayer, 
simplistic and great maps, had a few weaknesses in balance though)
3. CoD: BO 1 (they tried a new way, map design was ok but not comparible to 
mw 1 and 2, overall decent experience if only the maps were better and 
sniping improved)
2. CoD: MW 2 (insane multiplayer sometimes too over the top considering the 
ability to abuse the game, maps were still super good)

Personal top 5, because i've only owned cod from COD 4 to BO2. Basing this 
on the amount of fun i had with it along with the amount of hours i played 
it.
1) Modern Warfare 2: It was the first game that i could play online easily 
and it was just the most fun to me. 

2) Black Ops: It was the cod that i had the most hours put into. Something 
about the game. The simplicity. The historical point it covers. The 
currency mechanic the MP had. The zombies. It was just great.

3) Modern Warfare: It's what got me into video games. It was the first game 
i played on xbox live. I played the campaign at least 5 times! And it was 
the only cod where i had every achievement except for ONE! (Kudos if you 
know which one i'm talking about lol)

4) World at War: Last WW2 game. It was really simple. The campaign was 
harder than hell. It was probably the most leveled out multiplayer out of 
all the call of duties.

5) Modern Warfare 3: It was... the first game i tried to "try hard". It was 
the first game i "No lifed". It was the first one i took serious. And it 
was the first one that ruined call of duty for me. A 3.2 K/D. A 5.9 W/L 
that all meant nothing because i was burned out by March. Since than, i 
haven't a picked up a call of duty the same anymore.

I bought Black Ops 2 but within a week i was already done with it. It felt 
like a total waste of my time. I didn't even buy Ghost or AW although AW 
played a little bit more fun but still boring as hell when i played it at a 
friends house. 

After trying the past 3 maddens i've given up on gaming all together lol. ﻿

Played every multiplayer for a Call of Duty game for a combined 70+ days. 
As a veteran of the franchise my list goes:

1. Modern Warfare 2
2. Call of Duty 4
3. World at War
4. Black Ops 1
5. Black Ops 2
6. Modern Warfare 3
7. Call of Duty Ghost
8. Advanced Warfare

My K/D ratio was consistently 2.00 in every game until now. Now the game is 
tailored for little kids who don't know how to play correctly and a game 
that allows untalented players to perform well. I think other veterans 
players could agree with me. I miss the simplicity of the older games. I 
laughed out loud when I saw Ghost ranked higher than MW2. Thats a joke. Ive 
never had as much fun on any other game like I did on MW2. Mw2 use to have 
1.5 million people playing on Xbox 360 months after release. Now these 
games might have 50k players months after release. R.I.P. Call of Duty. 
Thumbs up so others can understand where this game stands in 2014.﻿

MY LIST:
1) Black ops 2 (best maps, a lot of fun weapons, zombies was just as good 
as in BO1, decent campaign, just a nice feel to it overall. What else can I 
say? It's one hell of a FPS)
2) MW2 was just an extraordinary game with epic multiplayer and very good 
campaign. Loved the weapons and the maps too)
3) MW (got the franchise very popular. Great game. Not one bad thing about 
it)
4) Black ops (extremely addictive COD with some awesome weapons and 
scorestreaks. Zombies was awesome and great campaign really miss this game)
5) MW3 (a very underrated COD. Not much wrong with it except it was a step 
down from the amazing MW1 & 2)
6) COD 2 (awesome game. Nothing wrong with it)
7) WaW (Great game, just destroyed by hackers)
8) COD (fun game and the original COD. Not much wrong with it)

I loved black ops 2 and I actually still play it. I loved the campaign 
because it had two time periods; the end of the cold war and 2025. I loved 
the choices you can make during the campaign too. Multiplayer is pretty fun 
for me, but I run into a few laggy players and screaming little kids on 
some matches. Zombies was bad without buying the DLCs. I think tranzit was 
a bad introduction to the bo2 zombies storyline. The DLCs were awesome. My 
favorite is die rise. I like how you can jump from building to building and 
buy perks inside elevators. But the close quarters does give me some 
surprises too. It's great. If treyarch is reading this, good job and please 
keep it up😉😂﻿

And here's my top 10 CoD games over the years:
10.Ghosts-horrible in every single aspect-story,mp,coop...EVERYTHING
9.Advanced Warfare-Oh look,an exo-suit in MP...not like we haven't played 
Titanfall or even better...UNREAL TOURNAMENT.The story did made up,but just 
a little.
8.MW3-campers,campers,campers.And a totally meh campaign epilogue.
7.MW2-shitty OP weapons,shitty OMA,shitty almost everything.The only thing 
I liked in MW2 was the diversity of killstreaks.From MW2 and up in my 
timeline,CoD just died.
6.Black Ops 2-horrible MP and lag, meh-ish zombie mode,but awesome campaign.
5.Black Ops 1-another good campain,a little less laggy MP and great zombie 
mode.
4.Call of Duty-the original was just awesome.
3.Call of Duty 2-if the original was awesome,the second was just 
mindblowing.
2.Call of Duty 4-a mouth of fresh air after many WW2 titles and the 
reinnovation of the MP with the class system and perks.And let's not forget 
the campaign.
And the number 1 CoD(unlike these IGN fucktards who can't put 1 and 1 
together):
1.Call of Duty World at War-over the top campaign(especially the 
gritty,brutal Soviet campaign),the introduction of Co-op in the series for 
up to 4 players,the introduction of Zombies was another sweet thing about 
it and last,but not least...the introduction of vehicles(yes,they were 
limited only to tanks,but hey.they are vehicles) in versus 
multiplayer.Overall,World at War is the last good and my personal best Call 
of Duty experience I've had so far.

P.S:I'm talking about PC title releases,NOT console exclusives like CoD 2 
Big Red One or Call of Duty 3 since I've never played them.﻿

In my personal experience I've always ranked it:
1. CoD4/WaW (CoD4 has the best single player set pieces, as well as some of 
the best multiplayer maps. Also, I always viewed WaW as a CoD4 expansion 
with WWII skins and the introduction of Zombies mode, so I've always lumped 
the two together) 
2. Black Ops (the most impressive CoD single player story, with some of the 
most solid multiplayer in CoD (as well as the best ranking system), and a 
refined zombies mode)
3. MW2 (a cheesy but enjoyable single player, with a multiplayer that 
bordered on bloated/broken at times, and satisfyingly arcadey at others)
4. Black Ops II (a bloated, somewhat dull single player, messy multiplayer, 
and a disastrous zombies implementation)
5. CoD 3: (this was my first CoD experience, it was on the Nintendo Wii, it 
was atrocious)

That's all the CoD I've ever got around the playing, I realize that CoD 1 & 
2 are important games in the series, but I can't rank what I've never 
experienced. Also, I've heard good things about Advanced Warfare, but after 
so many years with an iterative franchise like CoD, you get burned out.﻿

My list: 

*Dreadful* *Ones:*
11 - Call of Duty: Ghosts (10)
10 - Call of Duty: Advanced Warfare (11)
9 - Call of Duty: Black Ops 2 (9) 

Now onto the actual *playable* list: 

8 - Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 (8) 
This was the last Call of Duty game in which i actually found a sense of 
enjoyment in,  however it doesn't mean i like it! I actually take an 
extreme dislike to MW3 but still consider it commendable compared to the 
entries after this one, meaning i can actually sit through this game the 
whole way without giving up and possibly toss my copy in the trash. 

7 - Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2 (6) 
Ok, Im ready to catch hell for this one. Because i know MW2 is fairly well 
regarded, if not a lot of people's favourite one all together. However  i 
didn't like this one! I regard it as mediocre at best, hardly found any fun 
in this AT ALL. An extremely disappointing follow up to the first Modern 
Warfare and the game in the series that made it abundantly clear that COD 
would never be able to maintain its quality given its "one game a year" 
shipping period. I sometimes have a strong case of shuffling this one 
around with MW3. 

6 - Call of Duty: World at War (5) 
Ok, i think got past the 5 games that i truly dislike in the series, 
because World at War wasn't bad. I actually liked the concept of going back 
to World War II after MW and i adore Kiefer Sutherland and Gary Oldman. But 
where World at War faltered was at its player experience. We had perviously 
experienced MW1 and it was twice as  grand and epic in scale as World at 
War ever would be. So the main problem doesn't come from the game itself 
but the fact that we had experienced so much more from the entry that 
preceded this one. Oh yeah, and this introduced us to zombies!

5 - Call of Duty 3 (3) 
Call of Duty 3 used to be higher on this list and possibly even my 
favourite. But after going back and playing it recently, I'm shocked that i 
didn't realise, at the time, just how basic COD's third instalment was. I 
mean, Call of Duty had only released its third game. It was still a fresh 
young thing. And already a lack of innovation was evident. The vehicles? 
well yeah, they sufficed.  

4 - Call of Duty 2 (2) 
Im surprised i can't think of much to write about for Call of Duty 2, as i 
absolutely love this game. Lets put it as COD 2 had a lot to live up to 
after COD 1. And it did just that by amping everything up a notch. 
Campaign? Multiplayer? Graphics? Narrative? Yep, all doubled in scale! Im 
not saying its better than COD 1 (if you're following my list, you can 
clearly tell its not!) But it managed to live up and give its audience 
something fresh and new, while at the same time being very similar to the 
original. 

3 - Call of Duty: Black Ops (7) 
Yes, this isn't an illusion. Black Ops 1 is my third favourite Call of Duty 
game. Why? 
Awesome campaign with an intriguing story… *check* 
Vast collection of interesting characters…… *check* 
Amazing multiplayer with a collection of fantastic maps (yes, nuketown <3) 
*check*
Improved zombies mode… *check* 
Gary Oldman…. *check* 
Black Ops also has a special place in my heart for managing to convince me 
that this series had redeemed itself after MW2 (well atleast i remained 
hopeful for a whole year). 
Also, Dragovich takes the cake for the best "Big Bad" in the series. 

2 - Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare (4) 
Ah yes, good old fan-favourite COD Number 4. What is there to be say that 
hasn't already been said? If Call of Duty were to be stretched out into the 
2015 years of AD then COD 4 would be the period of Renaissance. This game 
reinvented the COD formula, bringing the WWII shooter into a Modern front 
and making it work. On top of that we got an overall great single player 
and great multiplayer (best one in the series) modes. COD 4 was exciting in 
both action and theme and gave us characters with depth and deep 
infrastructure so we would actually care for them, this clearly wasn't 
 evident in the first 3 entries. 

1 - Call of Duty (1) 
An unpopular opinion, i know, but Call of Duty 1 is my favourite. In my 
opinion COD 1 remains a wonderful gift. Containing all the initial element 
of COD that hooked us while also, strangely, remaining wonderfully sealed 
off. The main reason why this is my favourite is because how different it 
is from the other games. Normally if someone were only allowed to select 
one game out of the Call of Duty basket and asked you to voice your opinion 
as to which one to select, most people would go for COD 4. But me? no, i'd 
direct them to COD 1 because of how distant it feels from the other games 
while still maintaining its charm. In fact you could even convince someone 
that Call of Duty 1 is the only game in the series, and that the others are 
part of a different series also called Call of Duty. It stands on its own. 
If they'd never made another Call of Duty game, this game would have 
reached epic cult status by now. Its weird way of describing it but thats 
why i love this game so much.﻿

1.waw was my favorite because it was my first cod. I had the most memories 
with it and it will always be special to me

2. Bo2 and Mw2 are tied because they both have amazing multiplayer with the 
most fun kill streaks and guns. I love how in mw2 everything is eirther 
extremely overpowered or underpowered. And for bo2, like they said in the 
video, it was everything I really wanted in a call of duty game.

3. Had to put cod 4 up high because it is everybody elses favorite and I 
can see why. Great game over all but not my favorite.

4. Black ops one was fun. Had a great campaign and zombies mode. Didn't 
personally think multiplayer was all that great. Wager matches were fun but 
the guns and maps were lacking (besides nuketown and firming range) also, I 
personally think the graphics were very good even if they did get a lot of 
hate.

5. I thought exo suits were very good( for a while) however I don't really 
think the belong in a call of duty game. I liked the campaign but 
killstreaks lacked and exos in multiplayer just didn't seem to work.

6. Probably most played call of duty. (ironic how it's my second least 
favorite) I think they played it to safe with this game I tried to make to 
much like mw2, but they failed a bit. Just feel like they could have done a 
better job.

7. No description needed. The game speaks for itself﻿

My ranking of the Call of Duty games:

1. World at War (Brilliant campaign and multiplayer, introduction of Nazi 
Zombies)
2. Black Ops (Great campaign, decent multiplayer, great continuation of 
Zombies)
3. Modern Warfare (Thrilling campaign and multiplayer, changed the face of 
CoD)
4. Modern Warfare 2 (Good campaign, wasn't a fan of multiplayer, decent 
Special Ops)
5. Black Ops 2 (Good campaign and multiplayer, disappointed with Zombies)
6. Advanced Warfare (Decent campaign and multiplayer, alright Exo Zombies)
7. Ghosts (Decent campaign, alright multiplayer, disliked Extinction)

This is my opinion, if you think otherwise feel free to reply with your 
thoughts :)﻿
